storyInfo: As Theresis shifts the strategic focus to Victoria, the civil war reaches its final moments. The Doctor draws up one final plan to retake Kazdel, and Babel's victory is close at hand.

attributes.content: Spring, 1094
Rhodes Island of Babel, Kazdel
I knew you'd come, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I'm the only one left.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: After a few years here, you're the only one left, out of everyone I knew.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: This upcoming mission of yours...
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: In Londinium. You knew that already.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: To tell you the truth, I'm a little bit bothered by it. This isn't my first time going undercover, but...
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: It's the first time for me to step outside of Kazdel.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I heard you used to travel around for months?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: It's not the same as going to Victoria, though.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: You are going to be a sleeper agent in Theresis's mercenary army. When the time is right, you'll be provoking an armed rebellion.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Will killing Theresis really solve our problems?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: No. The Military Commission is no longer reliant on any one strongman. This is exactly what Theresis wants.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: So, the best way for you to accomplish your mission is to cause a disturbance at the right time. It'll sow doubts among the Victorian dukes, and they can do the dirty work for you.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Londinium is the heart of Victoria. They've got nowhere to run. The city will witness the downfall of the entire Military Commission.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: And then you guys will beat up the whole Nachzehrer Court and take back Kazdel, right?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Still, Julie, you should—
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Oh, don't be like that! I've been undercover before. It's just... you know, having to fool both Theresis and the Victorians at the same time... I've barely met any Feline who can do that!
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I've even been practicing my Victorian just for this...
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: That's not what I meant.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Never mind. Here, for you.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: What's this? My old clothes?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: My name's been sewn into the lining... Did Her Highness do this?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Her Highness wanted to give this to you in person, but I don't want you two to meet at this moment.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I... would rather she not have to suffer too much.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: You know what I mean. You know that everyone involved in this plan is considered sacrificed already.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Her Highness knows this. She wanted to say goodbye to you all in person, but that would only make it hard for her to sleep at night.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: So I lied to her. I told her you all left earlier than planned.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Julie. You might have wanted to meet Her Highness too.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Julie does not reply. She strokes the name sewn onto her clothes with linen, feeling its rough texture in silence.
'Julie'.
She remembers how Her Highness would teach them lessons.

She is more used to killing people than learning things in a classroom. Although she would doze off as she didn't understand a thing, she knew in her heart that everything Her Highness said was right.
That's why she has never raised a question in class.
Who wouldn't want to see Her Highness one last time? But I don't mind it's you who gives me this. I've learned a lot from you in these past few years too.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Ah. You're not thinking that you might be more qualified for this mission than I am, are you?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: No, I'm not.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: There were some people who actually mentioned you at the meeting earlier, but we all agreed that it's best if you stay in Kazdel with Her Highness.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: As for me, I've always been on my own, so I was the first to suggest...
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: You could go and join Scout's team. I remember you have already applied for it.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: That was just because I wanted to learn everything I could from a hero, all so that I could beat you one more time.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: We fight more or less in the same way. It's kind of a bummer leaving without having sparred enough with you.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Hmph. I really wouldn't be telling you all this if it wasn't for the fact that I'm about to head off already.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Do you... have anything else you'd like to say?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Nope. I never expected my first time leaving home would also be my last. I also never expected the person sending me off would be the unsmiling, silent head assassin who's always standing by the King's side.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Answer me honestly, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: What's it like out there, in the lands beyond Kazdel?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Ascalon does not answer. It seems that Julie did not expect to receive one in the first place.
Julie simply gets up and leaves at a languid pace.
As though she was just heading off to get a bottle of top-notch wine.
Ascalon watches her as she walks off into the distance.
She suddenly feels like there is something unfamiliar about Julie, the same feeling as if she were unable to recognize her own reflection in the mirror.
Three months later...
Village on the outskirts of Londinium, Victoria
Come out already. There's no use hiding.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: We received the info while in the city that there's a squad heading off to Kazdel. That must be you lot, right?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: We've blocked off all the other roads out of this village, and don't even think about passing through me here.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Got you.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Look at your wounds and all. I doubt you could beat a civilian in a state like this.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: She shakes her sword with disdain, flicking off the blood on it.
Or maybe you're waiting for your buddies to come help you out?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: ...The others are all dead?
attributes.name: Mysterious Assassin

attributes.content: As a doornail.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: All your friends are dead, so why does it feel like you're breathing a sigh of relief?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Death is but a mercy... my friend.
attributes.name: Mysterious Assassin

attributes.content: Who the hell are you guys?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: That does not matter.
attributes.name: Mysterious Assassin

attributes.content: Ngh... Gah...
attributes.name: Mysterious Assassin

attributes.content: Your blade struck true. *cough*...
attributes.name: Mysterious Assassin

attributes.content: She hears the assassin break out in laughter under her blade.
Only once he has finally stopped breathing does she peel off his mask.
Julie freezes. She thinks hard for a long while, before finally realizing the identity of the Sarkaz based on the marred birthmark by the corner of his eye.
His portrait had been circulated around the Scar Market's book of bounties before.
He had many aliases, but nobody knew what his real name was. He has been active for far too long, long enough to become the subject of boasts and quips from drunken mercenaries.
But the two horns that marked his bloodline and identity have been cut clean off, leaving eternal scars on his head.
Those other masked nutjobs willing to die for their cause... Did they also like chopping their horns off?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Did you need to go this far to muster enough courage to assassinate Her Highness? Was it because you had to bare steel against the King of Sarkaz, against one of the Six Heroes?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Whatever... I can tell just by looking at you all that you haven't dealt with Her Highness Theresa before.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Well, don't you worry, I'll burn away your faces. Sure, you'll be turned into some real stinky charcoal, but it beats being remembered as a sinner.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: You guys can't go back to Kazdel, and this is the only thing I can do to help you. To be honest, I don't think you and I are all that different.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I can't go back to Kazdel either.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Julie and her companions pile up the assassins' corpses, set the grisly pyramid alight, then set off in the direction of Londinium.
The blaze behind them crackles. A thought suddenly pops up in Julie's mind. The furnace in Kazdel doesn't sound like this.
What was it like? She heard it all the time when she was little.
...Can't remember any of it.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Our elites have been deployed to all the key strategic points.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Good. Listen up, there is a clear power gap between us and the Military Commission. Laying siege to Kazdel would have been an impossible operation.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But thanks to the Duke of Cavendish's ultimatum, Theresis has marched to Londinium earlier than planned.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Kazdel now only has some of the Royal Court factions aligned with the Military Commission to oversee it. He has almost abandoned the city.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: This has no doubt left both the civilians and remaining soldiers in disarray.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Once the banner of the Military Commission falls, Her Highness Theresa will proclaim that they have abandoned Kazdel, and in turn proclaim the liberation of Kazdel by Babel.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: This battle line will be formed by multiple points rather than an entire front. We must strike swiftly and precisely.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Due to the disparity in military strength, almost every single one of our armed personnel who still heeds the command of Babel has been assigned to taking the city.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Thus, the landship's defense will be relatively weak.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Her Highness Theresa will remain on the landship to balance the situation. We will retain a suitable force to guard the ship too, under my personal command.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Once the city gates of Kazdel have been broken open and the path to the Soul Furnace has been made safe, Her Highness will meet with the main army at all speed.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: We have six hours to storm the city, else the Military Commission will have the opportunity to organize a powerful counterattack. If that time comes, our weaker Babel forces will be exposed to danger.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: By the light of the setting sun, Babel will capture the Furnace and the Royal Court's chamber, and the banner of Babel will rise with the moons.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: And when that time comes...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: A ceasefire will resound across all Kazdel.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I have faith that we will all succeed.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Wonderful organization, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Just some big talk meant to boost morale. I'm sure Kal'tsit and our experienced fighters can see right through it.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Babel is going to take heavy losses.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It's not quite Theresis's style, allowing so many flaws to go exposed.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But I trust you, Doctor. I believe that with this price we must pay, we can take back Kazdel.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresis is going to fight for the power he most craves in Londinium. If our assumptions are correct, once he tears apart that empire, he will set his sights back on this city.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Is there no room for two Kazdels on this great land?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Perhaps there is. But if we were to split our combined strength in two, then we would not be able to resist the next invasion of our enemies.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Moreover, while the city can always be rebuilt, what the Sarkaz have been truly failed to do for millennia is to unify.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Even the Military Commission failed to gather together all the surviving factions of the Royal Court.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Are you wondering if things would be different if it was Theresis who wore the crown?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No, they wouldn't. The Sarkaz who'd come rushing into the city, escaping from wars and trying to feed themselves, would still band together and fight their King.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: To band together... Such a simple and yet unimaginable way to put it.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...Indeed.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: According to Kal'tsit's rough calculations, the population of Sarkaz currently living in Kazdel only constitutes thirty to forty percent of all Sarkaz across Terra.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A unification under the banner of hate would be effective yet short-lived. A unification under peace allows us to discuss development and our future.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It is not that Theresis or the Sarkaz does not understand all this, it's just that... the war broke out anyway.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Even if we take Kazdel back, Doctor, perhaps this war will still go on.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But maybe it will do for now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: After our victory, I'd like you to take a look around the city.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It is my home, and the home of many Babel Members... it is also Kal'tsit's home.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You have fought for Babel for so long, yet you have never set foot in the homeland of our memories. I haven't been a very good host in this deal of ours, have I, Doctor?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: See how the Soul Furnace brings light and heat to Kazdel, this city built on our pain, and you might see why we are so greedy in our desire for a peaceful tomorrow.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...I will.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Outskirts of an abandoned town, Kazdel
How are things in town, Odda?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: We're still pursuing the remaining mercenaries! They have pretty much all holed up inside some abandoned buildings. I'm afraid it'll take a while to root them all out.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Don't be reckless. Pay attention to the time and don't forget what the Doctor said.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Our objective is to clear the flanks, then regroup on the battlefront ASAP.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I know. If not for the Doctor's contingency plan, we most likely would have been gotten by that ambush of theirs.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: But... something's strange in this. It's clear that this town's right in the path of the Catastrophe, so why would this gang of mercs risk ambushing us here?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: I'm still investigating that myself.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: We just need to find their leader then, Ascalon, although I can't guarantee that they'll have answers we need.
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: I know. Stay safe.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: A Catastrophe. Its brutal winds batter Ascalon.
Faint blasts from the horizon distract her, as though they are reminding her—
We are destined to walk along this path.
...It's you.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Long time no see.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: You've grown, Ascalon. You really have toughened yourself up on the battlefield over the last few years.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: I assumed you would have joined that man in huddling behind Londinium's walls like a coward.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Me? Follow the Regent? Haha, I'm afraid you've got that wrong, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Mercenaries never 'follow' anyone. All we care about is profit.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Here in Kazdel, the only thing that helps you earn that profit is violence. Lucky for us that we have the knack of sniffing it out.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Naturally, I am happy to help everyone see what prospects might show up on this list of jobs in a suitable manner. After all, the Scar Market never makes wrong investment decisions—
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Ascalon's sleeve-blade stabs at the giant's back, only to find his hand blocking the attack.
It seems that his hand had been there all along. No movement is detected.
If he thought that you could stop us yourself, then I'm afraid that he's living in a fantasy.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Wrong again, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The mercenaries are here because of the Regent's commission. Yes. And it's none of my business. But have you ever wondered why I am here?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: I'm here to see you, Ascalon. A completely unrelated matter.
attributes.name: Scareye
Odda
attributes.content: *Bzzzzz*—Ugh—Ascalon, the town—

attributes.name: Odda
attributes.content: *Bzzzz*—Another ambush!
Odda? Odda!
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I didn't say you could leave, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The moment those people stepped into that town, their fates were sealed. You can't save them.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Do you still remember the first time we met?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: We're already at the confluence of fate.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Here, I see a rather abrupt ending.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: I've always wondered, could I change that ending? Perhaps I could dredge up a stone from the rough rapids of destiny...
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: ...And place it wherever I want, to see what ripples would arise that should not exist in the first place...
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Could the Cyclopes control prophecy?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Get lost.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Or die.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I already told you, there's no need to try for any surprise attacks. I can 'see' them coming.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Theresis has taught me many things, but there is only one thing I remember clear as crystal.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The blade in my hand can solve most of my problems.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Scareye... Can you see nothingness?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: A thick mist, mingled with dust, spreads across the area.
Everything is indistinct. The assassin's figure gradually becomes a blur in the fog.
Doesn't matter if it's fate or prophecy. I've had enough of your tricks.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: You believe you can see beyond time—
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: You believe you can rely on fate to guide you to your profit—
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: But you're nothing more than an addict playing at fortune-teller in the end, Scareye.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Ascalon's voice fades away. The giant's ears only hear the wind. The giant's eyes only see the mist.
Strange. Even though he can see a hundred different ways of his own death whenever he wakes up, now...
He sees none—
Crack.
His mask shatters.
His eyes had been hidden beneath that mask for nearly a century. He doesn't need them to see reality. Too many people, too many things, all unworthy of his sight.
And as the evening light rushes into the cracks on his mask, seeping into his excited, dilated pupils—
Do you see your death now?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: No. He sees a precipice.
The rapid waters of the confluence of fate are flowing over it.
Before we continue this fight, Ascalon, allow me to give you a prophecy, free of charge.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: A story.
attributes.name: Scareye
